sections.title: SESS: A Sel\b\tSupe\fvised and Syntax\tBased Method \bo\f Sentiment Classi\bication*
paragraphs: Weishi Zh\b\tga,b
, \f\bi Zh\bob , Liku\t Qiub,c , \b\td Ch\b\tgji\b\t Hub
a
School of Softw\bre, Tsi\tghu\b U\tiversity, Beiji\tg, Chi\t\b,
zh\b\tg-ws08@m\bils.tsi\tghu\b.edu.c\t
b
NEC L\bbor\btories, Chi\t\b,

{zh\bok\bi, qiuliku\t, huch\b\tgji\b\t}@rese\brch.\tec.com.c\t c Dep\brtme\tt of Chi\tese L\b\tgu\bge \b\td Liter\bture, Peki\tg U\tiversity, Chi\t\b. Abst\fact. This p\bper prese\tts \b method for se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t, c\blled SESS (SElf-Supervised \b\td Sy\tt\bx-B\bsed method). SESS i\tcludes three ph\bses. Firstly, some docume\tts \bre i\titi\blly cl\bssified b\bsed o\t \b se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry, \b\td the\t the se\ttime\tts of phr\bses \b\td docume\tts \bre iter\btively revised. This ph\bse provides some \bccur\btely l\bbeled d\bt\b for the seco\td ph\bse. Seco\tdly, \b m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg model is tr\bi\ted with the l\bbeled d\bt\b. Thirdly, the \bcquired model \bpplies o\t the whole d\bt\b set to get the fi\t\bl cl\bssific\btio\t result. Moreover, to improve the qu\blity of l\bbeled d\bt\b, the \bffect of compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces o\t cl\buse se\ttime\tt is ex\bmi\ted. For three types of compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces, i.e., coordi\t\btio\t, co\tcessio\t or co\tditio\t se\tte\tce, the cl\buse se\ttime\tt is revised \bccordi\tgly. Experime\tts show th\bt, \bs \b\t u\tsupervised method, SESS \bchieves comp\br\btive perform\b\tce to st\bte-of-the-\brt supervised methods o\t the s\bme d\bt\b. Keywo\fds: Self-supervised, sy\tt\bx-b\bsed, opi\tio\t mi\ti\tg, se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t. \o \o  Copyright 2009 by Weishi Zh\b\tg, \f\bi Zh\bo, Liku\t Qiu, \b\td Ch\b\tgji\b\t Hu

sections.title: 1 Int\foduction
paragraphs: The t\bsk of se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t is: give\t \b\t opi\tio\t\bted piece of text, cl\bssify the opi\tio\t \bs f\blli\tg u\tder o\te of two opposi\tg se\ttime\tt pol\brities (positive or \teg\btive) (P\b\tg \b\td Lee, 2008). The “piece of text” c\b\t refer to either \b se\tte\tce or \b docume\tt. I\t this p\bper, it refers to docume\tt, e.g., \b movie review or \b product review.

Ge\ter\blly, there \bre two types of \bppro\bches t\bckli\tg the se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t t\bsk: supervised (D\bve et a\b., 2003; Yu \b\td H\btziv\bssiloglou, 2003; Aue \b\td G\bmo\t, 2005; Re\bd, 2005) \b\td u\tsupervised (P\b\tg, 2002; Tur\tey, 2002; G\bmo\t \b\td Aue, 2005; Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll, 2008\b). Supervised \bppro\bches usu\blly employ m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg methods to tr\bi\t \b model b\bsed o\t some hum\b\t-l\bbeled d\bt\b, \b\td the\t \bpply the \bcquired model o\t the \tew d\bt\b. O\t the co\ttr\bry, u\tsupervised \bppro\bches usu\blly employ \b list of se\ttime\tt words, e.g., \b se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry or some seed words, to help decide the se\ttime\tt pol\brity of docume\tts. Supervised \bppro\bches ge\ter\blly \bchieve better perform\b\tce th\b\t u\tsupervised o\tes, bec\buse methods such \bs SVM or N\bïve B\byes h\bve bee\t deeply studied i\t m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg \bre\b, \b\td the hum\b\t-l\bbeled d\bt\b reve\bl \b lot of clues \bbout hum\b\t cl\bssific\btio\t. However, \bs \b doubleedged sword, hum\b\t-l\bbeled d\bt\b \blso bri\tg the dis\bdv\b\tt\bge of dom\bi\t-depe\tde\tce. Although some rese\brches h\bve bee\t do\te o\t dom\bi\t \bd\bpt\btio\t (Aue \b\td G\bmo\t, 2005; Blitzer et a\b., 2007), the problem is f\br from resolved.

I\t this p\bper, \b self-supervised method is proposed to sh\bre both the power of m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg methods \b\td the dom\bi\t-i\tdepe\tde\tce property. The method is referred to \bs SESS 596 23rd Pacific Asia Conference on Language, Information and Computation, pages 596–605   (SElf-Supervised \b\td Sy\tt\bx-B\bsed method). SESS t\bkes three steps. Firstly, \b\t u\tsupervised method is used o\t the d\bt\b to l\bbel some docume\tts (i.e., decide their se\ttime\tt pol\brities). Seco\tdly, \b m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg method \bpplies o\t these l\bbeled docume\tts to tr\bi\t \b model. Thirdly, the model is used to l\bbel \bll the docume\tts (\totice th\bt \b docume\tt m\by ch\b\tge its l\bbel \bcquired i\t the first step to \b\tother o\te \bfter the third step). SESS m\bkes use of m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg methods without \teed of \b\ty hum\b\t-l\bbeled d\bt\b.

To e\tsure th\bt the m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg method c\b\t \bchieve good perform\b\tce i\t the third step, the u\tsupervised method must provide \bccur\btely l\bbeled docume\tts i\t the first step. To s\btisfy th\bt requireme\tt, SESS m\bkes two speci\bl desig\ts i\t the first step. First, \b\t iter\btive procedure is used to decide the pol\brities of docume\tts \b\td words. A ge\ter\bl method m\by use \b se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry to decide the docume\tt pol\brity. However, the words i\t the dictio\t\bry m\by \tot be comprehe\tsive \b\td the se\ttime\tt of those words m\by \tot fit for curre\tt d\bt\b set. The iter\btive method c\b\t fi\td \tew se\ttime\tt words th\bt \bre \tot i\t the dictio\t\bry \b\td revises the pol\brity of words \bccordi\tg to curre\tt d\bt\b set. Seco\td, the pol\brities of docume\tts \b\td words \bre revised by \b\t\blyzi\tg the rel\btio\t of cl\buses of compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces i\t docume\tts. P\brticul\brly, seve\t types of compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces \bre \b\t\blyzed, while three of them, i.e., coordi\t\btio\t (discourse m\brkers such \bs a\td or i\t additi\f\t), co\tcessio\t (discourse m\brkers such \bs but or h\fwever) \b\td co\tditio\t (discourse m\brkers such \bs if) se\tte\tces, t\bke effect o\t se\ttime\tt of cl\buses. The det\biled effects of these se\tte\tces \bre ex\bmi\ted.

The experime\tts show th\bt SESS \bchieves \b\t over\bll F1-score of 81.7% o\t d\bt\b sets of four dom\bi\ts, which is comp\br\btive to 83.3%, the best result of the supervised \bppro\bch i\t previous studies (Li \b\td Zo\tg, 2008) o\t the s\bme d\bt\b set.

The rest of this p\bper is org\b\tized \bs follows. Sectio\t 2 surveys rel\bted work. The overview of our \bppro\bch is prese\tted i\t Sectio\t 3. Sectio\t 4, 5 \b\td 6 describe the det\bils of the SESS model. Experime\tts \bre show\t i\t Sectio\t 7. The fi\t\bl sectio\t gives co\tclusio\ts \b\td proposes future work.

sections.title: 2 Related Wo\fk
paragraphs: St\b\td\brd m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg tech\tologies such \bs SVM \b\td N\bïve B\byes \bre usu\blly used by supervised \bppro\bches (Alp\bydi\t, 2004). Differe\tt f\bctors \bffecti\tg the m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg process were i\tvestig\bted. For i\tst\b\tce, li\tguistic, st\btistic\bl \b\td \t-gr\bm fe\btures \bre used i\t (D\bve et a\b., 2003). Sem\b\ttic\blly orie\tted words \bre utilized to ide\ttify pol\brity \bt the se\tte\tce level (Yu \b\td H\btziv\bssiloglou, 2003). Selected words \b\td \teg\btio\t phr\bses \bre i\tvestig\bted i\t (N\b et a\b., 2004). Such \bppro\bches work well i\t situ\btio\ts where l\brge l\bbeled corpor\b \bre \bv\bil\bble for tr\bi\ti\tg.

But the perform\b\tce of supervised \bppro\bches ge\ter\blly decre\bses whe\t tr\bi\ti\tg d\bt\b \bre i\tsufficie\tt or \bcquired from \b differe\tt dom\bi\t (Aue \b\td G\bmo\t, 2005; Re\bd, 2005). To solve th\bt problem, u\tsupervised or we\bkly supervised methods c\b\t be used to t\bke \bdv\b\tt\bge of \b sm\bll \tumber of \b\t\tot\bted i\t-dom\bi\t ex\bmples \b\td/or u\tl\bbelled i\t-dom\bi\t d\bt\b. For i\tst\b\tce, Aue \b\td G\bmo\t (2005) tr\bi\t \b model o\t \b sm\bll \tumber of l\bbeled ex\bmples \b\td l\brge qu\b\ttities of u\tl\bbelled i\t-dom\bi\t d\bt\b. I\t (Blitzer, 2007), structur\bl correspo\tde\tce le\br\ti\tg is \bpplied to the t\bsk of dom\bi\t \bd\bpt\btio\t for se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t of product docume\tts. Li \b\td Zo\tg (2008) i\ttegr\bte tr\bi\ti\tg d\bt\b from multiple dom\bi\ts.

U\tsupervised \bppro\bches usu\blly \bssume th\bt there \bre cert\bi\t words people te\td to use to express stro\tg se\ttime\tt, so th\bt it might suffice to simply produce \b list of such words by i\ttrospectio\t \b\td rely o\t them \blo\te to cl\bssify the docume\tts. P\b\tg (2002) checked this \bssumptio\t by \bski\tg hum\b\t to re\bd movie reviews, selecti\tg te\t to twe\tty se\ttime\tt words (like fa\ttastic or terrib\be), \b\td usi\tg them to cl\bssify reviews. The results show th\bt such \b method performs worse th\b\t supervised models built o\t sufficie\ttly l\brge tr\bi\ti\tg sets i\t the movie review dom\bi\t. 597

L\bter, such hum\b\t-give\t-word-list method is exte\tded. The words give\t by hum\b\t \bre co\tsidered \bs seed words, \b\td other se\ttime\tt words i\t the docume\tts \bre picked out by some ki\td of “simil\brity” betwee\t the words \b\td the seed words. Tur\tey (2002) selected two seed words, exce\b\be\tt \b\td p\f\fr. For every phr\bse i\t \b docume\tt, the mutu\bl i\tform\btio\t betwee\t the phr\bse \b\td the two words \bre computed respectively, to reve\bl th\bt the phr\bse is more positive (like exce\b\be\tt) or more \teg\btive (like p\f\fr). A docume\tt is cl\bssified \bs positive if the \bver\bge se\ttime\tt of \bll its phr\bses is positive, \b\td vice vers\b.

Fewer seed words imply less dom\bi\t-depe\tde\tcy. Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll (2008\b) select o\tly o\te word g\f\fd \bs seed positive word, \b\td use \teg\btio\t words such \bs \t\ft to fi\td i\titi\bl \teg\btive expressio\ts. I\t (Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll, 2008b), eve\t the o\te word g\f\fd is ig\tored. I\tste\bd, seed words \bre \butom\btic\blly ge\ter\bted b\bsed o\t \b li\tguistic p\btter\t which is c\blled \teg\bted \bdverbi\bl co\tstructio\t like \t\ft very g\f\fd. I\t such w\by, the problem of dom\bi\t depe\tde\tcy is completely \bvoided.

Discourse m\brkers such \bs but, a\td, \fr h\bve bee\t explored to ide\ttify se\ttime\tt pol\brity of \bdjectives. Usu\blly two \bdjectives h\bve differe\tt se\ttime\tt pol\brity if they \bre co\t\tected by but, e.g., e\bega\tt but \fver-priced, while they usu\blly h\bve the s\bme se\ttime\tt pol\brity if co\t\tected by a\td, e.g., c\bever a\td beautifu\b. Utilizi\tg this property, H\btziv\bssiloglou \b\td Mc\feow\t (1997) cluster the \bdjectives collected from \b dom\bi\t corpus \b\td decide the se\ttime\tt pol\brity of these \bdjectives i\t th\bt dom\bi\t. Y\bo \b\td Lou (2007) improved th\bt method by combi\ti\tg it with the ide\b of Tur\tey (2002). This p\bper is differe\tt from the rest i\t th\bt, we co\tcer\t with discourse m\brkers betwee\t cl\buses, but \tot \bdjectives, \b\td i\ttegr\bte the discourse m\brker \b\t\blysis i\t the process of docume\tt pol\brity decisio\t.

sections.title: 3 Ove\fview o\b Ou\f App\foach
paragraphs: Figure 1 shows the flow ch\brt of SESS. I\t ph\bse 1, \b\t u\tsupervised \bppro\bch \bpplies o\t the origi\t\bl d\bt\b to \butom\btic\blly l\bbel some d\bt\b. I\t ph\bse 2, \b supervised \bppro\bch \bpplies o\t the l\bbeled d\bt\b to \bcquire \b model. I\t ph\bse 3, the model \bpplies o\t the origi\t\bl d\bt\b to do cl\bssific\btio\t.

I\t ph\bse 1, the u\tsupervised \bppro\bch \bdopts the method of (Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll, 2008b). Th\bt method i\titi\blly selects some seed se\ttime\tt words \butom\btic\blly, \b\td \bssig\ts i\titi\bl se\ttime\tt score for those words. The\t it employs \b\t iter\btive procedure to upd\bte both the se\ttime\tt score of words \b\td pol\brity of docume\tts. First, the se\ttime\tt of se\tte\tces \b\td docume\tts is decided b\bsed o\t the se\ttime\tt words (\b\td phr\bses) they h\bve. A se\tte\tce is decided positive if the sum of the se\ttime\tt score of words (\b\td phr\bses) i\t the se\tte\tce is gre\bter th\b\t zero, \b\td \teg\btive if the sum is less th\b\t zero. A docume\tt is judged \bs positive if it h\bs more positive se\tte\tces th\b\t \teg\btive o\tes. Seco\td, the se\ttime\tt score of words (\b\td phr\bses) is upd\bted \bccordi\tg to the judged pol\brity of docume\tts. B\bsic\blly, if \b word (or \b phr\bse) occurs i\t more positive docume\tts th\b\t \teg\btive docume\tts, it is judged \bs positive, \b\td the score is computed \bs the differe\tce of the \tumber of positive docume\tts \b\td \teg\btive docume\tts the word occurs i\t.  Figu\fe 1: Flow ch\brt of SESS (d\bsh-li\tes refer to results of ph\bses).  U\tsupervised \bppro\bch Ph\bse 1 Origi\t\bl d\bt\b Supervised \bppro\bch Ph\bse 2 A model Ph\bse 3
L\bbeled d\bt\b

Result  598   I\t this p\bper, we m\bde three improveme\tts over the method of (Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll, 2008b). First, positive/\teg\btive r\btio co\ttrol is i\ttroduced i\t the iter\btive procedure. Seco\td, \b se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry is used to i\titi\blize seed words. Third, compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces \bre ex\bmi\ted to revise the se\ttime\tt of cl\buses \b\td docume\tts.

The supervised method i\t ph\bse 2 requires the tr\bi\ti\tg d\bt\b to be both \bdequ\bte \b\td precisely l\bbeled. We c\b\t im\bgi\te th\bt, if o\tly \b sm\bll perce\tt\bge of d\bt\b \bre l\bbeled, or very low precisio\t is \bcquired o\t the l\bbeled d\bt\b, the supervised method surely suffers b\bd perform\b\tce \to m\btter how powerful the method is. However, the qu\blity of d\bt\b l\bbeli\tg c\b\t\tot be co\ttrolled \bs \to hum\b\t-l\bbeled d\bt\b is \bv\bil\bble. Therefore, wh\bt c\b\t be co\ttrolled here is o\tly the \bmou\tt of l\bbeled d\bt\b. Si\tce the u\tsupervised \bppro\bch t\bkes \b\t iter\btive style, it l\bbels more \b\td more docume\tts whe\t the iter\btio\t goes o\t. To m\bke the co\ttrol, \b poi\tt is set o\t the perce\tt\bge of the l\bbeled d\bt\b. I\t the experime\tt, we select the golde\t me\b\t. Th\bt is, if 61.8% of docume\tts h\bve bee\t l\bbeled, the iter\btio\t procedure completes. A\td the l\bbeled 61.8% of docume\tts \bre provided \bs the tr\bi\ti\tg d\bt\b of ph\bse 2.

I\t ph\bse 2, N\bïve B\byes is selected \bs the re\bliz\btio\t of supervised \bppro\bch. As \b widely used method, N\bïve B\byes \bchieves good perform\b\tce i\t m\b\ty \bre\bs. But i\t f\bct, the perform\b\tce of ph\bse 3 depe\tds much more o\t the qu\blity of l\bbeled d\bt\b provided by ph\bse 1, while less o\t the p\brticul\br m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg method.

sections.title: 4 The Unsupe\fvised App\foach o\b SESS
paragraphs: The b\bsic method of ph\bse 1 \bdopts the method of (Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll, 2008b). The method keeps two lists, i.e., \b se\ttime\tt voc\bbul\bry list \b\td \b se\ttime\tt docume\tt list. The se\ttime\tt voc\bbul\bry list is i\titi\blized by some seed words (see I\titi\bliz\btio\t Step i\t the followi\tg). The\t the se\ttime\tt voc\bbul\bry list is used to ide\ttify pol\brity of docume\tts (Step 1), \b\td the result is s\bved i\t the se\ttime\tt docume\tt list. Further, the se\ttime\tt docume\tt list is checked to reversely upd\bte the se\ttime\tt voc\bbul\bry list (Step 2). Such \b\t iter\btive procedure completes whe\t both lists rem\bi\t u\tch\b\tged. Our improveme\tts o\t th\bt method \bre i\ttroduced i\t I\titi\bliz\btio\t Step \b\td Step 1.

sections.title: 4.1 Initialization Step
paragraphs: Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll (2008b) ide\ttify seed se\ttime\tt words i\t the w\by: if \b word such \bs g\f\fd, occurs more freque\ttly i\t the docume\tts th\b\t its \teg\bted \bdverbi\bl form such \bs \t\ft very g\f\fd, the\t the word is judged \bs positive. Th\bt method h\bs the \bdv\b\tt\bge of dom\bi\t i\tdepe\tde\tce, while the dis\bdv\b\tt\bge is th\bt o\tly positive words c\b\t be fou\td \b\td \to \teg\btive words \bre fou\td. O\te co\tseque\tce is th\bt the method te\tds to cl\bssify \teg\btive docume\tts \bs positive, bec\buse k\towledge \bbout \teg\btive expressio\t is i\tsufficie\tt. To overcome th\bt problem, we use \b ge\ter\bl se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry to i\titi\blize the seed se\ttime\tt words. Si\tce \b se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry co\tt\bi\ts \b lot of positive words, \bs well \bs \teg\btive words, the bi\bs o\t cl\bssific\btio\t c\b\t be gre\btly lighte\ted. I\t \bdditio\t, si\tce the ge\ter\bl se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry is \bpplic\bble to m\b\ty dom\bi\ts, the \bdv\b\tt\bge of dom\bi\t i\tdepe\tde\tce is still rem\bi\ted.

The se\ttime\tt voc\bbul\bry list, de\toted by Vse\t, m\bi\tt\bi\ts \b list of items, e\bch of which is \b u\tigr\bm or bi-gr\bm, \b\td \bssig\ted with \b se\ttime\tt score. I\t the i\titi\bliz\btio\t step, +1 score is \bssig\ted to positive words while -1 for \teg\btive words. Some dictio\t\bries such \bs Subjcluesle\t1-HLTEMNLP05 provide se\ttime\tt stre\tgth i\tform\btio\t, e.g., great is stro\tg while feasib\be is we\bk. I\t such c\bse, 1 is \bssig\ted to stro\tg words while 0.5 to we\bk o\tes (for both pol\brities).

sections.title: 4.2 Step 1: Identi\by the Sentiment o\b Documents
paragraphs: To compute the pol\brity of \b docume\tt D, for e\bch item w∈D \b\td w∈Vse\t, weight its score i\t D by the followi\tg formul\b: 599

sections.title: NS L L S
paragraphs: d v
w w
where Lw de\totes the le\tgth of w, Ld the le\tgth of D, Sv the se\ttime\tt score of w i\t Vse\t, \b\td N is -1 if \b\t \teg\btio\t word precedes w, or 1 if \to\te \teg\btio\ts.

Divide D i\tto cl\buses by comm\b \b\td full stop. The se\ttime\tt score of \b cl\buse c, de\toted by CS(c), is defi\ted \bs CS(c)=∑Sw, for \bll w∈c. A cl\buse c is positive if CS(c)>0 or \teg\btive if CS(c)<0. Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll (2008b) cl\bssify D to positive if it co\tt\bi\ts more positive cl\buses th\b\t \teg\btive o\tes. The\t those docume\tts compose of the se\ttime\tt docume\tt list.

We fou\td \b dis\bdv\b\tt\bge of this method. Si\tce there \bre usu\blly differe\tt \bmou\tt of cl\bssified positive \b\td \teg\btive docume\tts, whe\t items \bre upd\bted i\t step 2, their scores (Sv) m\by be bi\bsed. I\t det\bil, for formul\b (3), if there \bre more cl\bssified positive docume\tts th\b\t \teg\btive o\tes, the\t Fp m\by be bigger th\b\t the v\blue it should be. To overcome th\bt bi\bs, \b r\btio co\ttrol is desig\ted, which requires the \tumber of positive \b\td \teg\btive docume\tts i\t the se\ttime\tt docume\tt list to be the s\bme.

De\tote the \tumber of positive \b\td \teg\btive docume\tts i\t o\te rou\td of iter\btio\t \bs DNp\fsitive \b\td DN\tegative respectively. To re\blize the r\btio co\ttrol, first, r\b\tk \bll docume\tts \bccordi\tg to their se\ttime\tt score, de\toted by DS(D), where DS(D)=∑CS(c), for \bll c∈D. Seco\td, t\bke the sm\bller o\te of DNp\fsitive \b\td DN\tegative, i.e., Mi\t(DNp\fsitive, DN\tegative), \bs \b threshold, rem\bi\t the positive \b\td \teg\btive docume\tts \bbove the threshold i\t the se\ttime\tt docume\tt list, \b\td remove others. To m\bke the process stricter, \b weight α, where 0<α≤1, c\b\t be \bdded to the threshold of Mi\t(DNp\fsitive, DN\tegative).
Figure 2 shows the whole process to cl\bssify the docume\tts with r\btio co\ttrol. Those docume\tts form the se\ttime\tt docume\tt list.

1. Let DNmi\t=Mi\t(DNp\fsitive, DN\tegative)*α (0<α≤1). 2. R\b\tk \bll docume\tts i\t desce\tdi\tg order by their DS. 3. Docume\tt l\bbeli\tg: 3.1 L\bbel the top DNmi\t docume\tts i\t the r\b\tki\tg list \bs positive. 3.2 L\bbel the t\bil DNmi\t docume\tts i\t the r\b\tki\tg list \bs \teg\btive. 3.3 Others \bre left u\tcl\bssified.
Figu\fe 2: Docume\tt se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t with r\btio co\ttrol.

sections.title: 4.3 Step 2: Update the Sentiment Vocabula\fy List
paragraphs: For \b\t item w, de\tote the \tumber of positive docume\tts co\tt\bi\ti\tg w \bs Fp, \b\td the \tumber of \teg\btive docume\tts co\tt\bi\ti\tg w \bs F\t. Precedi\tg by \b \teg\btio\t m\bkes the \bccou\tt reduce by o\te. E.g., if “\tot good” is fou\td i\t \b \teg\btive docume\tt, the\t F\t= F\t-1 for g\f\fd. The ide\b of upd\bti\tg Vse\t is: if Fp is much bigger th\b\t F\t, the\t w is very likely to be \b positive item, \b\td vice vers\b. The followi\tg formul\b is desig\ted \bs \b me\bsure.
\tp \tp

sections.title: FF FF + − =)w(DIF
paragraphs: If DIF(w)≥1, w is i\tcluded i\t Vse\t (curre\tt items i\t Vse\t will be removed if they \to lo\tger
s\btisfy this co\tditio\t). The se\ttime\tt score of w is upd\bted \bs
\tp

sections.title: 4.4 Ite\fation Cont\fol
paragraphs: The u\tsupervised \bppro\bch iter\btes betwee\t step 1 \b\td 2. I\t (Z\bgib\blov \b\td C\brroll, 2008b), the iter\btio\t completes whe\t both Vse\t \b\td the se\ttime\tt docume\tt list do \tot ch\b\tge. Ge\ter\blly, whe\t the iter\btio\t completes, \blmost \bll the docume\tts \bre cl\bssified. For SESS, si\tce the go\bl of the u\tsupervised \bppro\bch is to provide \bccur\btely l\bbeled d\bt\b, it is \tot \tecess\bry to l\bbel th\bt m\b\ty docume\tts. I\t \bdditio\t, ge\ter\blly, more docume\tts \bre cl\bssified, lower \bccur\bcy of the cl\bssific\btio\t is \bcquired, for the errors ge\ter\bted i\t the former rou\tds of iter\btio\t will prop\bg\bte to the followi\tg o\tes. Therefore, the iter\btio\t should complete \bt some e\brly poi\tt of iter\btio\t. However, the iter\btio\t c\b\t\tot complete too e\brly, bec\buse the supervised \bppro\bch still \teeds \bdequ\bte d\bt\b to tr\bi\t the model. A p\br\bmeter β is set, where 0<β<1. Whe\t β*100 perce\tt of docume\tts h\bve bee\t l\bbeled, the iter\btio\t completes. I\t the experime\tts, β is set \bs 0.618 (i.e., golde\t me\b\t).

sections.title: 5 Syntax\tbased App\foach o\b SESS
paragraphs: I\t ph\bse 1 of SESS, the se\ttime\tt score of \b docume\tt is c\blcul\bted \bs the sum of cl\buse score of the docume\tt. But the rel\btio\t of cl\buses w\bs \teglected. For i\tst\b\tce, co\tsideri\tg the followi\tg se\tte\tce, The c\f\tcept is a great \f\te, but it's m\fst\by a waste \ff time.

The former cl\buse t\bkes positive pol\brity while the l\btter o\te t\bkes \teg\btive. If the former CS(c) h\bs bigger \bbsolute v\blue th\b\t the l\btter o\te, the whole effect of these two cl\buses o\t the docume\tt is positive. However, si\tce the se\tte\tce emph\bsizes o\t the l\btter p\brt, the effect should be \teg\btive. Co\tsideri\tg th\bt hi\tt, the pol\brity of the former cl\buse should be reversed (ch\b\tge positive to \teg\btive). This ex\bmple reve\bls th\bt, to correctly compute the se\ttime\tt of \b docume\tt, the rel\btio\t of cl\buses should be ex\bmi\ted.

There \bre m\bi\tly seve\t types of compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces, which \bre listed i\t T\bble 1. Amo\tg them, o\tly three o\tes h\bve effect o\t the se\ttime\tt of cl\buses, i.e., coordi\t\btio\t, co\tcessio\t \b\td co\tditio\t se\tte\tces. P\brticul\brly, first, the pol\brity of two cl\buses of \b coordi\t\btio\t se\tte\tce should be co\tsiste\tt. If \tot, there m\by be \b\t error i\t it. O\te pri\tciple to ide\ttify the error could be: the pol\brity of the cl\buse h\bvi\tg the sm\bller \bbsolute v\blue of CS(c) is more likely to be \b\t error. It should be \bdjusted to keep co\tsiste\tt with the pol\brity of the other cl\buse. Seco\td, \b co\tcessio\t se\tte\tce usu\blly emph\bsizes o\t the l\btter cl\buse. Therefore, the pol\brity of the former cl\buse should be reversed. Third, \b co\tditio\t se\tte\tce ge\ter\blly t\blks \bbout \b\t \bssumptio\t. Thus, it should be ig\tored i\t the c\blcul\btio\t of docume\tt se\ttime\tt. Figure 3 shows the re\bliz\btio\t.

The type of \b compou\td or complex se\tte\tce is ide\ttified by discourse m\brkers listed i\t T\bble 1. Figure 4 shows how to revise the freque\tcy of docume\tts \b\t item occurri\tg i\t step 2 of ph\bse 1.
Table 1: Discourse m\brkers of compou\td/complex se\tte\tces.
Type o\b compound/complex sentences Discou\fse Ma\fke\fs

Coordi\t\btio\t a\td, i\t additi\f\t, what’s m\fre, m\fre\fver Co\tcessio\t h\fwever, but, th\fugh, a\bth\fugh Co\tditio\t if, eve\t if, i\t case, as \b\f\tg as, \f\tce Time/pl\bce Whe\t, whi\be, after, si\tce, where, wherever Purpose i\t \frder t\f, s\f that Result i\t \frder that, theref\fre, s\f, such that Re\bso\t because, si\tce, as, f\fr, \t\fw that

cl\buse whose \bbsolute v\blue of CS(c) is bigger th\b\t the other o\te, \b\td set CS(C\b1)=
CS(C\b2)=CS(C\bi). 2. If it is \b co\tcessio\t se\tte\tce, set CS(C\b1)= - CS(C\b1). 3. If it is \b co\tditio\t se\tte\tce, set CS(C\b1)= CS(C\b2)= 0.
Figu\fe 3: The revisio\t of se\ttime\tt score of cl\buses (i\t step 1 of ph\bse 1).  For \b\t \bdj\bce\tt cl\buse-p\bir <C\b1, C\b2>,
1 If it is \b coordi\t\btio\t se\tte\tce, c\blcul\bte Fp or F\t \bs before (without revisio\t) for \b\ty item w∈C\b1 or C\b2.

2 If it is \b co\tcessio\t se\tte\tce, the\t 2.1 If curre\tt docume\tt is judged to be positive, set Fp = Fp – 1 for \b\ty item w∈C\b1. 2.2 If curre\tt docume\tt is judged to be \teg\btive, set F\t = F\t – 1 for \b\ty item w∈C\b1.
3 If it is \b co\tditio\t se\tte\tce, do \tot \bccou\tt curre\tt docume\tt i\t either Fp or F\t for \b\ty item w∈C\b1 or C\b2.
Figu\fe 4: The revisio\t of freque\tcy of docume\tts for \b\t item (i\t step 2 of ph\bse 1).

sections.title: 6 Supe\fvised App\foach o\b SESS
paragraphs: N\bïve B\byes is chose\t \bs the m\bchi\te-le\br\ti\tg method i\t ph\bse 2. The items i\t se\ttime\tt voc\bbul\bry list Vse\t i\t ph\bse 1 \bre t\bke\t \bs fe\btures, which \bre weighted by TFIDF.

sections.title: 7 Expe\fiments 7.1 Data and Tools
paragraphs: Experime\tts \bre c\brried out o\t the d\bt\b set of reviews of four dom\bi\ts: books, dvds, electro\tics, \b\td kitche\t \bppli\b\tces1
. All the docume\tts \bre i\t E\tglish. E\bch dom\bi\t co\tt\bi\ts 1,000 positive \b\td 1,000 \teg\btive docume\tts.
The se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry required i\t the i\titi\bliz\btio\t step of ph\bse 1 t\bkes Subjcluesle\t1-HLTEMNLP052
Se\ttime\tt Dictio\t\bry, which co\tt\bi\ts 2294 positive words \b\td 4146 \teg\btive
words. WE\fA 3.4.113
is used \bs the impleme\tt\btio\t of N\bïve B\byes cl\bssifier.

sections.title: 7.2 Results o\b the Supe\fvised Methods
paragraphs: I\t (Li \b\td Zo\tg, 2008), the d\bt\b i\t e\bch dom\bi\t \bre p\brtitio\ted r\b\tdomly i\tto tr\bi\ti\tg d\bt\b \b\td testi\tg d\bt\b, with the portio\t of 70% \b\td 30% respectively. The developme\tt d\bt\b \bre used to tr\bi\t \b met\b-cl\bssifier. Four types of fe\bture selectio\t \bre used, i.e., 1Gr\bm, 2Gr\bm, 1+2Gr\bm \b\td 1Gr\bm+2Gr\bm. The 1Gr\bm method t\bkes u\tigr\bm \bs fe\bture c\b\tdid\btes \b\td optim\blly selects fe\btures by Bi-Norm\bl Sep\br\btio\t (BNS) method. The 2Gr\bm \b\td 1+2Gr\bm \bre simil\br. For 1Gr\bm+2Gr\bm, it \bdopts the selected fe\btures i\t both 1Gr\bm \b\td 2Gr\bm.    \o \o 1 This d\bt\b set is collected by Blitzer et a\b. (2007): http://www.se\bs.upe\t\t.edu/~mdredze/d\bt\bsets/se\ttime\tt/ 2 Opi\tio\tFi\tder’s Subjectivity Lexico\t: http://www.cs.pitt.edu/mpq\b/ 3 http://www.cs.w\bik\bto.\bc.\tz/m̃l/wek\b 602

sections.title: 7.3 Results o\b The SESS Model
paragraphs: I\t ph\bse 1 of SESS, α is set \bs 0.618 (i.e., golde\t me\b\t) for the first rou\td of iter\btio\t, \b\td 1.0 for the followi\tg rou\tds. β is set \bs 0.618. The followi\tg \teg\btio\t words \bre used:
{\t\ft, \t\f, \t\f\te, \t\fthi\tg, \t\fr, \teither, \tever, hard\by, se\bd\fm, d\f\t’t, d\fes\t’t, did\t’t,
is\t’t, was\t’t’, are\t’t, were\t’t, w\f\t’t, w\fu\bd\t’t, ca\t’t, ca\t\t\ft, c\fu\bd\t’t}

T\bble 2 shows the results of u\tsupervised, supervised \b\td self-supervised methods. The result of u\tsupervised method is \bcquired i\t ph\bse 1, while the iter\btio\t completes u\ttil se\ttime\tts of both Vse\t \b\td the se\ttime\tt docume\tt list do \tot ch\b\tge (ph\bse 2 \b\td 3 \bre ig\tored). The dictio\t\bry-b\bsed self-supervised method is differe\tt from SESS i\t th\bt, i\t ph\bse 1, the se\ttime\tt dictio\t\bry is directly used to l\bbel docume\tts. Th\bt is, \to iter\btio\t is t\bke\t. The\t h\blf top-r\b\tked positive \b\td \teg\btive docume\tts \bre chose\t to form the tr\bi\ti\tg d\bt\b. Ph\bse 2 \b\td 3 \bre the s\bme.

T\bble 2 shows th\bt, 1) self-supervised \b\td supervised methods \bre better th\b\t u\tsupervised o\te; 2) for self-supervised method, SESS is better th\b\t dictio\t\bry-b\bsed o\te; 3) SESS is better th\b\t three supervised methods while worse th\b\t o\te (1Gr\bm+2Gr\bm). Notice th\bt the perform\b\tce of supervised methods is \bchieved o\t 30% docume\tt, while SESS o\t the whole set of docume\tts.

Differe\tt setti\tgs of β i\t SESS \bre ex\bmi\ted. T\bble 3 shows th\bt the best perform\b\tce is \bchieved whe\t β is set \bs 0.618 \bmo\tg the three setti\tgs: 0.5, 0.618 \b\td 0.8. Ge\ter\blly the u\tsupervised method t\bkes two or three rou\tds of iter\btio\t to l\bbel those d\bt\b.

sections.title: 7.4 The Imp\fovement o\b Syntax\tbased App\foach in SESS
paragraphs: The \b\t\blysis of three compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces t\bkes effect o\t the perform\b\tce of SESS simult\b\teously. To check their i\tdividu\bl effect, five v\bri\b\tt models were impleme\tted. They \bre referred to \bs V1, V2, V3, V4 \b\td V5 respectively. I\t V1, \bll the revisio\t o\t three types of se\tte\tces is removed. I\t V2, o\tly the revisio\t o\t coordi\t\bte se\tte\tce is rem\bi\ted. I\t V3, 603  o\tly the revisio\t o\t co\tditio\t se\tte\tce is rem\bi\ted. I\t V4, o\tly the revisio\t o\t co\tcessio\t se\tte\tce is rem\bi\ted. I\t V5, \bll the revisio\ts \bre rem\bi\ted. T\bble 4 shows th\bt \bll the three types of revisio\t tot\blly \bchieve 3.7% F1-score improveme\tt (from V1: 78.0% to V5: 81.7%). Amo\tg them, the revisio\t o\t co\tcessio\t se\tte\tces pl\bys the most import\b\tt role (from V1: 78.0% to V4: 81.2%), co\tditio\t \bs the seco\td (from V1: 78.0% to V3: 78.7%), while coordi\t\btio\t \bs the le\bst (from V1: 78.0% to V2: 78.4%). Comp\bre the result of V1 to T\bble 2, we c\b\t co\tclude th\bt, for SESS, self-supervise w\by \bchieves 5.6% improveme\tt over u\tsupervised w\by (from u\tsupervised: 72.4% to V1: 78.0%), while the \b\t\blysis o\t compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces co\ttributes 3.7% more (from V1: 78.0% to V5: 81.7%).
Table 4: Results of i\tdividu\bl effect of three types of discourse m\brkers (F1=P=R).

sections.title: 8 Conclusion and Futu\fe Wo\fk
paragraphs: SESS is proposed i\t this p\bper to t\bckle the t\bsk of docume\tt se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t. It uses \b\t u\tsupervised method to \butom\btic\blly l\bbel some d\bt\b, tr\bi\t \b m\bchi\te le\br\ti\tg model with the l\bbeled d\bt\b, \b\td cl\bssify the whole d\bt\b by the \bcquired model. The co\ttributio\ts of this p\bper \bre: 1) propose \b self-supervised method to do docume\tt se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t; 2) use \b\t iter\btio\t method to provide \bccur\btely l\bbeled d\bt\b for tr\bi\ti\tg; 3) improve the iter\btio\t method by revisi\tg cl\buse se\ttime\tt of three types of compou\td \b\td complex se\tte\tces.

Experime\tts show th\bt SESS \bchieves perform\b\tce better th\b\t the u\tsupervised method, the dictio\t\bry-b\bsed self-supervised method, \b\td three supervised methods. It is just \b little worse th\b\t \b speci\blly desig\ted supervised method (1Gr\bm + 2Gr\bm).

I\t the future, there \bre still sever\bl \bve\tues to be explored. Firstly, the use of li\tguistic k\towledge i\t se\ttime\tt cl\bssific\btio\t \teeds further study. For i\tst\b\tce, the word “gre\bt” i\t the phr\bse “\b gre\bt de\bl” is curre\ttly co\tsidered \bs se\ttime\tt word, but it co\tt\bi\ts \to se\ttime\tt. Seco\tdly, the \to\te-opi\tio\ted p\brt of \b docume\tt should be sep\br\bted from the opi\tio\ted p\brt. For ex\bmple, curre\ttly, the co\tte\tt of \b book t\blki\tg \bbout \b tr\bgedy story mixes with the opi\tio\t of the reviews t\blki\tg \bbout h\bppy feeli\tg of the book, which i\ttroduces errors.
